newsitem.title: GERMANY: Preussag won't joint German steel venture.
newsitem.headline: Preussag won't joint German steel venture.

text.p: German diversified industrial group Preussag AG said on Wednesday it had no interest in forming a German steel giant with the merged operations of rivals Krupp and Thyssen.
Preussage Stahl AG had nothing to fear from the steel venture Thyssen AG and Fried. Krupp AG Krupp-Hoesch agreed to form, Preussag chief Michael Frenzel said at the company's annual meeting.

"Size alone is no advantage," he said in response to questions from shareholders. Preussag was well positioned with its market share and there was no internal logic for joining a German steel combine, he added.
He also said Preussag's steel subsidiary would benefit from the reduction in German steel capacity that the Thyssen-Krupp merger would bring.
